title: Depth Meter
summaries: The Depth Meter is an informational accessory that displays the player's depth. It is required to craft the GPS, which can then be used to craft the PDA and the Cell Phone. The Depth Meter is dropped by Cave Bats, Giant Bats, Jungle Bats, Spore Bats(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions), and Ice Bats, with a chance of 1*1/100 (1%) (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) / 0.5*1/200 (0.5%) (Old-gen console and 3DS versions). On the [img:Desktop version] Desktop, [img:Console version] Console, and [img:Mobile version] Mobile versions, it also drops from Salamanders, Giant Shellys, and Crawdads, with a chance of 1.25*1/80 (1.25%). In the [img:Old-gen console version] Old-gen console version, the Depth Meter may also be crafted.

• On the [img:Desktop version] Desktop version, [img:Console version] Console version, and [img:Mobile version] Mobile version, depth is measured in feet, with one tile equaling two feet.
  • On the [img:Old-gen console version] Old-gen console version, depth is measured in meters, with two tiles equaling one meter.
  • On the Nintendo 3DS[img:Nintendo 3DS version] version, depth is not measured, and the only benefits the accessory grants are from its modifiers.

Depth is measured relative to the boundary between the <linked>Surface</linked> and <linked>Underground</linked> layers, which has a depth of 0 and is displayed as "Level". The display shows the vertical distance to this line and the name of the current layer.
